     <h1>
      Welcome to BC BookWorld's Information Station!
     </h1>
     <div class="boxright">
      <a href="http://bcbooklook.com" target="_blank">
       <img alt="BC Booklook Website" longdesc="http://bcbooklook.com/" src="images/bcbooklook.jpg"/>
      </a>
      <br/>
      <br/>
      <p>
       <a href="http://bcbooklook.com" target="_blank">
        Look at the new BC Booklook Website!
       </a>
      </p>
     </div>
     <p>
      We're a newspaper about books. We've been around since 
 
         1987. We aspire to middle-brow usefulness. Four times per year, we produce 
 
         Canada's largest-circulation independent publication about literature.
     </p>
     <p>
      Our newspaper is available via more than 675 non-virtual 
 
         distributors, or by subscription. We believe people can make up their 
 
         own minds as to what they ought to read -- so we provide lively, up-to-date, 
 
         unbiased news.
     </p>
     <h2>
      Subscribe
     </h2>
     <p>
      If you live in Canada, you are invited to become a Subscriber/Supporter 
 by sending $25 for one year or $40 for two years via Paypal, or by mailing payment directly to 
 BC BookWorld, 3516 West 13th Avenue, Vancouver, B.C. V6R 2S3.
     </p>

     <h2>
      George Woodcock Lifetime Achievement Award
     </h2>
     <p>
      The GEORGE WOODCOCK LIFETIME ACHIEVEMENT AWARD annually honours an outstanding literary career in British Columbia. Since 1994, the City of Vancouver (Mayor of Vancouver's office), the Vancouver Public Library, and a non-profit society (Pacific BookWorld News Society, founded in 1988) have been working in partnership to jointly sponsor and present an annual prize to a senior B.C. author.
      <a href="http://www.georgewoodcock.com" target="_blank">
       Find out more about the George Woodcock Lifetime Achievement Award here.
      </a>
     </p>
